page.title: 16CONSERVATION AREAS
page.content: Duddingston Loch and Arthur's Seat have limited the outward growth of {Duddingston village}on most sides and it has to a large extent retained its original form. Since 1975 the village and the surrounding land have been a Conservation Area. Some{20}buildings are{"listed"}and have survived in a relatively unaltered state or have been carefully restored. Also important to local character are the large gardens, mature trees and high stone boundary walls. The{Portobello Conservation Area}was designated in 1977 and covers much of the old burgh. It derives its character from the many elegant terraces and villas built during the 18th and 19th centuries and from its mature trees, small parks and sea views. Some{250}buildings are{"listed" but many are of a minor category.
